Line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.0225, 0.0]. 2. Line_2: Start Point = [0.0225, 0.0], End Point = [0.0225, 0.0225]. 3. Line_3: Start Point = [0.0225, 0.0225], End Point = [0.0, 0.0225]. 4. Line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0225], End Point = [0.0, 0.0]. * Create the second loop (loop_2) as an inner loop: 1. Line_1: Start Point = [0.0015, 0.0015], End Point = [0.021, 0.0015]. 2. Line_2: Start Point = [0.021, 0.0015], End Point = [0.021, 0.021]. 3. Line_3: Start Point = [0.021, 0.021], End Point = [0.0015, 0.021]. 4. Line_4: Start Point = [0.0015, 0.021], End Point = [0.0015, 0.0015]. 3. **Transform 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by the factor 0.0225 using the sketch_scale parameters, and then transform it using the euler angles and translation vector defined before. 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the sketch with the following parameters: an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.75 units, and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normals. The sketch scale is 0.0225. The operation is to create a new solid body. The part has the following measurements: - Length: 0.0225 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0225 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular metal object with a central hole Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketch The sketch for this part is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. It consists of four faces: face\\_1, face\\_2, face\\_3, and face\\_4. In this instruction, we will only cover face\\_1, as the other faces contain similar features. Face 1 Face\\_1 consists of four lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4) arranged in a square shape, and three circles (circle\\_1 to circle\\_3) that form a central hole. * Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0]; End Point [0.75, 0.75] * Line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] The circles are as follows: * Circle\\_1: Center [0.15, 0.15]; Radius: 0.0375 * Circle\\_2: Center [0.375, 0.45]; Radius: 0.165 * Circle\\_3: Center [0.6, 0.15]; Radius: 0.0375 Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by 0.15 units and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. Perform a "JoinFeatureOperation" between this part and any previous parts. Description The dimensions of the part are as follows: length = 0.75, width = 0.75, height = 0.15. The object has a flat base and a slightly tapered top, and a circular hole located in the center of the object. It is symmetrical along its central axis.</description>
